key_points: Mary Trump believes her uncle, Donald Trump, would not sacrifice himself for his children if prosecutors targeted them.
She claimed Donald Trump would expect his children to take a hit for him, to his benefit.
Mary Trump doubts Donald would understand that prosecutors often seek to have individuals flip to target bigger entities.
She speculates that Donald Trump's children might actually flip if pressured by prosecutors.
The interview with Mary Trump was conducted by CNN's Chris Cuomo.
Her comments highlight a belief in Donald Trump's self-interest over familial protection.
The Trump Organization, where Donald Trump's sons Eric and Donald Jr. are employed, is under criminal investigation in New York.
Prosecutors in Georgia and Washington, DC, are also investigating Donald Trump's own actions.
The investigation contexts underscore the potential legal pressures facing the Trump family.
Mary Trump's insights provide a critical view of Donald Trump's character and priorities.
